block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
Music

CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Concerts by Candlelight'' featuring The D'Amore Duo. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. in the Henry Sawyer Room. Tickets: $7, or free with dinner. ''La Dolce Vita'' cabaret of movie songs of the 1960's, featuring Jilline Ringle. Through Aug. 20. Performances are at 9 p.m. on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday evenings. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people; $8 for children under 12. 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
Music

CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Concerts by Candlelight'' featuring The D'Amore Duo. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. in the Henry Sawyer Room. Tickets: $7, or free with dinner. ''La Dolce Vita'' cabaret of movie songs of the 1960's, featuring Jilline Ringle. Through Aug. 20. Performances are at 9 p.m. on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday evenings. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people; $8 for children under 12. 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.
CRESCENT SCHOOL The Waldwick Band, featuring Signe Myhren, mezzo-soprano, and Lew Archer, saxophonist. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. The Crescent School, Crescent Avenue, Waldwick. (201) 664-2939.

FAIR LAWN SUMMER MUSIC FESTIVAL The North Jersey Brass Quintet. Tonight at 8:30 p.m. Symphony Orchestra, Marvin Von Deck, conductor, featuring Anne Marie Church, soprano. Next Sunday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Memorial Park, Berdan Avenue, Fair Lawn. (201) 796-6746.

FREE PUBLIC LIBRARY OF ELIZABETH ''Inti Raymi: Musica Latinoamericana,'' a South American folk ensemble using authentic instruments. Saturday at 2:15 p.m. 11 South Broad Street, Elizabeth. (908) 354-6060.

MAHWAH PUBLIC LIBRARY Summer Music Festival presents Olga Dyachkovskaya, soprano. Monday at 7 p.m. ''Mostly Romantics,'' featuring the students of the Academy of Music Summer Festival. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. 100 Ridge Road, Mahwah. (201) 529-7323.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Mary J. Blige. Today at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $35 to $65. ''Absolut Sounds of the City 2000,'' outdoor music series. Thursday evenings, 5 to 10 o'clock, through Aug. 31. Stars of Oasis, Middle Eastern percussion ensemble; Brasil & Co., Bossa Nova; and Vocal Desandann, Haitian-Cuban folk. Free. Theater Square. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

NEWARK'S NEIGHBORHOOD SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Larry Norman. Thursday at 7 p.m. Hank Aaron Field, 208-210 Court Street. David Braham. Saturday at 6 p.m. Ivy Hill Park, Mt. Vernon Place and Tuxedo Parkway. Free. (973) 733-6454.

NORTH WILDWOOD SUMMER SERIES The Mills Family Variety Act. Thursday at 8 p.m. Al Alberts and Big Band. Saturday at 8 p.m. North Wildwood's amphitheater, Ocean and Second Avenues. Free. (609) 889-2241.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Through Sept. 9. Thursday evening classical series features Joseph Alessi, trombonist, with Gordon Turk, organist. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Pete Fountain with The Dukes of Dixieland. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 (reserved); $20 (general admission). The Great Auditorium, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645.
PALISADES INTERSTATE PARK COMMISSION Summer Outdoor Concert Series with the Blue Chip Barbershop. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. ($4 parking charge.) Alpine Picnic Area, Alpine Pavilion. (201) 768-0379.
PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM Westminster Choral Festival, Robert Page, conductor. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.

SHANGHAI JAZZ Ruby Braff, jazz, featuring Bucky Pizzarelli, guitarist. Today at 5:30 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $59 per person (includes dinner and show). Reservation only. Rio Clemente, pianist. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Morris Nanton Trio. Thursday at 7 p.m. Bernard ''Pretty'' Purdie Trio. Friday at 6:45 p.m. and 8:30 p.m.; Saturday at 6:45 p.m. and 8:45 p.m. No cover; $15 to $25 minimum. 24 Main Street, Madison. (973) 822-2899.
SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION Tommy Dorsey Orchestra. Tonight at 7 p.m. Free. Duke Island Park bandshell, across from Visitor's Center. (908) 722-1200, ext. 351.

WESTMINSTER CHOIR COLLEGE OF RIDER UNIVERSITY Summer Concerts 2000. Lois Laverty, singer and conductor, will lead participants in a hymn sing. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Charles Walker, a Westminster faculty member, will conduct a sing-in. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Akiko Hosaki, pianist, will perform a concert with a chamber orchestra conducted by Maurice Boyer. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Westminster High School Music Theater Workshop. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Westminster Middle School Piano Camp concert. Friday at 2 p.m. Magnum Opus choral ensemble concert. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Bristol Chapel, 101 Walnut Lane, Princeton. (609) 921-2663, ext. 308.
Theater
CIRCLE PLAYERS ''Pippin.'' Through Saturday. Today at 2 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $13; $12 for Sunday matinees. 416 Victoria Avenue, Piscataway. (732) 968-7555.

EATONTOWN PLAYHOUSE ''Three Murders and It's Only Monday,'' murder mystery comedy spoof. Friday through Aug. 27. Fridays at 8:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $17 for Fridays and Saturdays; $16 for Sundays; $15 for students and older people on Fridays and Saturdays; $10 for students and older People on Sundays. 37 Highway 35 North, Tower Shopping Center, Eatontown. (732) 460-0100.
FRANK SINATRA PARK AMPHITHEATER ''On the Waterfront,'' theatrical staged reading. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Frank Sinatra Drive, between 4th and 5th Streets, Hoboken. (201) 420-2207.

GARRIS CENTER THEATER ''Sylvia,'' A. R. Gurney's comedy performed by Tri-State Actors Theater. Through next Sunday. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m.; today and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $13 for students and older people and Sunday matinees; $11 for students and older people for Sunday matinees. 6 Broad Street, Branchville. (888) 840-7889.
HUDSON SHAKESPEARE COMPANY ''Othello.'' Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Free. Frank Sinatra Park, Frank Sinatra Park between 4th and 5th Streets, Hoboken. (201) 420-2207.

HUNTERDON HILLS PLAYHOUSE ''Razzmatazz,'' musical celebrating popular songs of the 20th Century. Through Sept. 9 Monday through Saturday luncheon matinees beginning at 11 a.m.; Saturdays at 6:30 p.m.; Sundays at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $39.50 to $51 (includes show and lunch/dinner). ''Branson 2000,'' country variety show featuring Tim Gillis and his Band and Kassie DePaiva. Today at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $45 (dinner and show). Exit 12 off Routes 78 and 22, Perryville. (800) 447-7313.

KELSEY THEATER ''Ginny Reilly and David Maloney -- Together Again.'' Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people; $5 for children. Mercer County Community College, 1200 Trenton Road, Trenton. (609) 584-9444.

LUMIA THEATER ''The Girl With the High Rouge,'' Vincent Sessa's surreal comic-drama, performed by the New Jersey Repertory Company. Through Aug. 20. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25; $35 for July 28, including reception. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.
LUMIA THEATER -- STAGE II ''My Simple City,'' staged reading. Tomorrow at 2 p.m. at 7 p.m. Tickets: $7.50. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

MANALAPAN-ENGLISHTOWN MIDDLE SCHOOL ''Man of La Mancha,'' performed by Manalapan Community Players. Today at 2 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10 at the door; $8 in advance. 155 Millhurst Road, Manalapan. (732) 446-3007.

McCARTER THEATER Mikhail Baryshnikov and The White Oak Dance Company. Thursday through Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $45 to $50. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY TheaterFest, the Professional Equity Theater-in-Residence in ''High Spirits,'' starring Kim Zimmer. Today and next Sunday at 3 p.m., Tuesday through Saturday at 8 p.m., Wednesday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $35; $28 for older people. Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-5112.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Summer Youth Performance Workshop in ''Brigadoon.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $16; $8 for children under 14. Victoria Theater. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

PARAMOUNT THEATER Charles Gounod's ''Faust,'' performed by the Metro Lyric Opera. Saturday at 8:15 p.m. (curtain); 7:30 p.m. (pre-opera talk). Tickets: $20 to $45. Ocean and Fifth Avenues, Asbury Park. (732) 768-4122.

PARSIPPANY PLAYHOUSE ''Tony n'Tina's Wedding,'' presented by Allegro Productions. Friday through Aug. 13. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 (dinner and show). 1130 Knoll Road, Parsippany. (973) 263-7020.

PLAYS IN THE PARK ''The King and I.'' Wednesday through Aug. 12. Performances every night at 8:30 p.m. except Sundays. Tickets: $3; free for children 12 and under. Stephen J. Capestro Theater, Roosevelt Park, off of Route 1 South, Edison. (732) 548-2884.

PREMIER THEATER COMPANY ''Mame.'' Friday through Aug. 19. Thursday, Friday and Saturday performances at 8 p.m.; Sunday matinees at 2 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for older people; $15 for students; $12 for children, 12 and under. Algonquin Arts Theater, 169 Main Street, Manasquan. (732) 223-7122.

THEATER UNDER THE STARS ''Guys and Dolls.'' Through Aug. 13. Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays at 8 p.m. Free. Degnan Park, next to West Orange High School, Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange. (973) 325-0795.
Museums and Galleries

CERULEAN FINE ARTS GALLERY ''New Works,'' a summer membership show, with paintings in all media, sculpture and photography. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 4 to 9 p.m. Headquarters Plaza Mall, Speedwell Avenue (Route 202), Morristown. (973) 267-3730.
CHAMOT GALLERY ''Modern Life,'' photography exhibit. Through Aug. 13. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. 111 First Street, Jersey City. (201) 610-1468.
CITY WITHOUT WALLS ''The Mask: Magic or Menace.'' Through Aug. 25. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, noon to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. One Gateway Center, Newark. (973) 622-1188.

CLEOPATRA STEPS OUT GALLERY ''Hang 10,'' fine crafts, home accessories, paintings and photography by 10 contemporary artists. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Mondays through Wednesdays by appointment. 721 Cookman Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 774-6306.

GROUNDS FOR SCULPTURE ''Summer 2000 Exhibition.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday by appointment. 18 Fairgrounds Road, Hamilton Township. (609) 586-0616.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES ''Exploring Collage,'' exhibit by Naomi Kahan, a Ridgewood artist. Tuesday through August 29. Artist's reception: next Sunday, 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m to 10 p.m.; Friday and Sunday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 433.

JERSEY CITY MUSEUM ''The Prints of a Sculptor,'' by Melvin Edwards. Through Oct. 7. Hours: Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays, 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.to 8 p.m. 472 Jersey Avenue, Jersey City. (201) 547-4514.

LAUREL TRACEY GALLERY Summer Sculpture Series featuring works by Don Bonham, Don Harger, Michael Malpass and Jon Peters. Through Aug. 19. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Sundays, 12:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. 10 White Street, Red Bank. (732) 224-0760.

MAKEREADY PRESS GALLERY ''Hilltop Images'' photographic images by Mike Peters. Through Aug. 12. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. Gallery 214, 214 Glenridge Avenue, Montclair. (973) 744-8290.

MONMOUTH MUSEUM ''New Jersey's Pinelands: Water in the Balance.'' Through Sept. 3. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $4. 761 Newman Springs Road, Lincroft. (732) 747-2266.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Croquet: The Art of Play.' Through Oct. 15. Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m.; Sept. 9 through Oct. 15, course will be open Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $4 for children. Will Barnet: A Timeless World. Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''A Collector's Vision: Selections From the Collections of Edmund W. Pease and Nurak Israsena.'' Through Sept. 17. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $5; $3 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.
NABISCO GALLERY ''Alchemy: Society of Layerists in Multi-Media.'' Through Sept. 6. Hours: daily, noon to 4 p.m. 100 DeForest Avenue, East Hanover. (973) 503-2000.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''Building a Collection: Fine Art at the New Jersey State Museum.'' Through Aug. 20. ''Leah Phyfer Sloshberg Collection of Fine Art.'' Through Sept. 3. ''The Art of Jack Delano.'' Through Sept. 4. ''Of Rock and Fire.'' On extended view. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Wetlands.'' Through Sept. 17. ''2000 New Jersey Fine Arts Annual: Into the Millennium.'' Through Sept. 17. ''The Luminous Image, V,'' and exhibition of illuminated photography. Wednesday through Oct. 8. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.

NOYES MUSEUM OF ART Inspired by Nature series, featuring ''Recreating Flowers: The Glass Wonders of Paul J. Stankard.'' Through Sept. 3. ''Capturing the Jersey Shore: Works of Anthony J. Rudisill.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.

RIPLEY'S BELIEVE IT OR NOT! MUSEUM ''African Fertility Statues.'' Thursday through August 25. Hours: Everyday, 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. New Jersey at New York Avenue and the Boardwalk, Atlantic City. (609) 347-2001.

WHEATON VILLAGE ''American Glass: 1900-2000,'' featuring more than 100 industrial and decorative pieces. Through Oct. 22. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $6 for older people; $3.50 for students. ''HER,'' multi-media exhibit. Through Aug. 13. No admission charge to the Gallery of American Craft. Exit 26, Route 55, Millville. (800) 998-4552, extension 2756.
For Children
EATONTOWN PLAYHOUSE ''Vappo the Clown'' Comedy Magic Show. Saturday at 4 p.m. For ages 4 to 7. Tickets: $7.50. 37 Highway 35 North, Tower Shopping Center, Eatontown. (732) 460-0100.

FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Stuart Little.'' Tuesday through August 19. Tuesdays and Thursdays at 10 a.m.; Wednesdays at 1 p.m.; Saturdays at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

KELSEY THEATER ''The Emperor's New Clothes'' performed by the Westminster Conservatory Summer Children's Opera Workshop. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $5. Mercer County Community College, 1200 Trenton Road, Trenton. (609) 921-7104.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Where in the Universe Is Carmen Sandiego?'' at the Alice and Leonard Dreyfuss Planetarium. Through October. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays at 2:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2 for members; $1 for children and older people. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6355.

NEW JERSEY CITY UNIVERSITY ''Chemistry for Kids'' for children in grades five through eights and ''Fun with Science'' for children in grades two through four. Tomorrow through Thursday. ''Chemistry for Kids,'' 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; ''Fun with Science,'' 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. Registration fee for each course: $75; plus an additional $10 materials fee. 2039 Kennedy Boulevard, Jersey City. (201) 200-3089.

RITZ THEATER ''Big, the Musical.'' Through Saturday.Today at 2 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $16 for Friday and Saturday; $12.50 for today. 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (856) 858-5230.

STONY BROOK-MILLSTONE WATERSHED ''Clearwater Trip,'' three-hour educational trip from Liberty State Park. Today at 11:30 a.m.; returning at 6:30 p.m. Fee: $100; $90 for children (includes transportation and lunch). ''Shapes in Nature'' for preschoolers and parents. Tomorrow, Tuesday and Thursday, 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. Fee; $12. ''Super Summer Scavenger Hunt.'' Saturday, 10 a.m. to noon. Fee: $10. Pre-registration is required. Buttinger Nature Center, 31 Titus Mill Road, Pennington. (609) 737-7592.

WALT WHITMAN CULTURAL ARTS CENTER Fun Summer Fridays, through Aug. 25. The Millennium Show. Friday, 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Free; donations accepted. Johnson Park at Second and Copper Streets, Camden. (856) 964-8300.
Spoken Word

EAST BRUNSWICK LIBRARY Laura Lawrence, a Bahai, will give a slide presentation on ''Pilgrimage to the Holy Land.'' Saturday at 2:30 p.m. Free. 2 Jean Walling Civic Center Drive, East Brunswick. (732) 517-8816 (to reserve a seat) or (732) 390-6950.

ETHICAL CULTURE SOCIETY Eli Schaap, community activist, and founder of the Partnership Fund for Teaneck, will discuss ''Israel: Inner Conflicts and the Peace Process.'' Next Sunday at 11 a.m. 687 Larch Avenue, Teaneck. (201) 836-5187.

NEW JERSEY CITY UNIVERSITY Karen DeAngelis, diretor of the Women's Center of New Jersey City University, will speak on ''How to Finance Your College or Graduate Education.'' Wednesday, noon to 1:30 p.m. Free. Pre-registration is required. Women's Center, 32 College Street, Jersey City. (201) 200-3189.
Etc.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Wednesday Night Comedy Film Festival.'' Through August. ''The Russians Are Coming! The Russians Are Coming!'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Seating is limited to 65 people. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215, ext. 244.

HISTORIC COLD SPRING VILLAGE Saturday Evening Concert Series. Through Sept. 2. Garden State Music Ensemble. Saturday at 6:30 p.m. Village Gazebo. Free. Route 9, three miles north of Cape May City. (609) 898-2300.

MONMOUTH COUNTY FAIR Today, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Animals, competitions, entertainment, rides and food. Admission: $4; free for children 12 years old and under. Kosloski Road, between Routes 33 and 537, Freehold Township. (732) 842-4000.

NEW JERSEY FESTIVAL OF BALLOONING Today, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. Festival will feature balloon ascensions today at 6:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m.; performances by Parrotville (1 p.m. and 5 p.m.); the Nerds (2:30 p.m. and 6:15 p.m.); Richard Scarry's Busytown Express Tour (various times); E Team, Elvises of the Sky (10 a.m. and 4 p.m.) and more. Tickets: on sale at all Quick Chek stores; $15 (advance); $20 (at the gate); $6 for children, 4 to 12 years old; $10 (at the gate). Solberg Airport, Readington. (800) 468-2479.

NEW JERSEY STORYTELLING FESTIVAL Today, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. ''Connecting the Global Community,'' featuring forty New Jersey storytellers presenting stories for adults and children; music and children's activities. Waterloo Village, 525 Waterloo Road, off Interstate 80, Exit 25, Stanhope. (973) 347-0900 or (973) 625-8548.

PEACH FESTIVAL AND COUNTRY AUCTION Saturday, 10 a.m to 4 p.m. Homemade peach cobbler, kuchen, pies and ice cream will be served in a historic country church atmosphere. Other features include children's boutique, hayrides, face painting, and games and prizes for children. The Country auction will start at 10 a.m. Community Presbyterian Church, 220 Main Street, Chester. (908) 879-5091.

RNS SHOW HOUSE AT THE SHORE The Ruth Newman Shapiro Cancer and Heart Fund will present its 10th annual exhibition of interior design rooms, decorative painting and outdoor living spaces. Through Aug. 13. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. Oceanside 1 and 2, the Boardwalk and Madison Avenue, the Northeast Inlet, Atlantic City. (609) 822-6338.

SOUTH ORANGE TASTING ''A Taste of South Orange'' offering cuisine from around the world. Wednesday and Aug. 9, 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. Countries represented at food pavilions include Italy, Japan, Ireland, India, United States and Caribbean Islands. The Ben William's Jazz Quartet will provide entertainment. Spiotta Park, South Orange. (973) 763-6899.
At the Casinos
All tickets are available through Ticketmaster, (800) 736-1420.

BALLY'S PARK PLACE ''Legends in Concert,'' impersonations of Stevie Wonder, Little Richard, Elvis Presley, Linda Ronstadt and Barbara Streisand. Mondays through Thursdays at 3:30 and 7:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 and 10:30 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 and 10 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $25. Park Cabaret, Boardwalk and Park Place. (800) 225-5977.

CAESARS ATLANTIC CITY Don Rickles. Today at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35. Bobby Vinton. Friday through next Sunday. Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m.; next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35. Circus Maximus Theater, 2100 Pacific Avenue. (800) 677-7469.

CLARIDGE HOTEL World Class Rockers. Today at 7 p.m. Tickets: $30. ''Pump Boys and Dinettes,'' national tour of the Broadway musical. Saturday through Sept. 24. Performances are Mondays through Thursdays at 8 p.m.; Saturdays at 9 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15, Sundays through Thursdays; $19, Saturdays. Palace Theater, Boardwalk and Park Place. (609) 340-3700.

SANDS HOTEL AND CASINO Jerry Blavat. Thursday, 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. Bud Noble. Wednesday through Saturday, 6 p.m. to 10 p.m. Dr. Cheeko. Wednesday through Saturday, 10:15 p.m. to 2:15 a.m. Copa Lounge. Free. The Diamonds. Through Sept. 10. Call for times. Tickets: $15. Cozy Morley. Tuesdays and Wednesdays through Aug. 30, at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15. Indiana Avenue and Brighton Park. (609) 441-4137.

TROPICANA ''If You Ever Leave Me . . . I'm Going With You,'' a comedy starring Renee Taylor and Joe Bologna. Today at 4 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $25, $35 and $40. The Moody Blues. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $55 to $75. Latin Fever Revue. Through Sept. 21. Call for times. Tickets: $9.90. ''Titanic: The Return,'' all new exhibition with more than 250 artifacts. Through Sept. 9. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Tickets: $14.95; $6.95 for children, ages 5 to 11. Grand Exhibition Center, fourth floor, South Tower. Boardwalk and Brighton Avenue. (609) 340-4020.
TRUMP MARINA KC and The Sunshine Band. Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $35. Grand Cayman Ballroom. Huron Avenue and Brigantine Boulevard. Grand Cayman. (800) 777-8477.

TRUMP PLAZA ''Dancin' in the Streets,'' a song and dance block party. Mondays and Thursdays at 4 p.m.; Tuesdays through Thursdays at 7:30 p.m.; Fridays at 9 p.m. and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 31. Tickets: $18; $12 for matinees. Boardwalk at Mississippi Avenue. (800) 759-8786.

TRUMP TAJ MAHAL Tom Jones. Today at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 and $50. Chaka Khan. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $40 and $50. The Robert Cray Band. Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $35. Xanadu. 1000 Boardwalk. (609) 449-1000.

Correction: August 7, 2000, Monday A picture caption last Monday about Hillary Rodham Clinton's campaign appearance at the Metropolitan A.M.E. Church in Harlem misstated the title of a hymn sung by the choir. It was ''Order My Steps,'' not ''All of My Steps in the World.''
Correction: August 7, 2000, Monday

A picture caption last Monday about Hillary Rodham Clinton's campaign appearance at the Metropolitan A.M.E. Church in Harlem misstated the title of a hymn sung by the choir. It was ''Order My Steps,'' not ''All of My Steps in the World.''
